item.title: Perchlorate: A Hazard and a Resource
item.description: ClO4- (Perchlorate) Perchlorate is abundant in the Martian regolith. Is this chemical a hazard for future Martians or is it a resource? Here is a great paper that discusses why perchlorate is both a resource and a hazard: Perchlorate - A Resource and a Hazard ClO4- 1% of the regolith (and several orders of magnitude higher than earth) Disrupts thyroid function and will kill us. Very solable in H2O (hard to contain) Dust fines are an important vector of this hazard to control via water spray-down and other mining-industry refined techniques Rocket Fuel Can be metabolized by anerobic microbes to purify and produce O2 100 g of enzyme + 6kg of soil + H2O = 1 hour of O2 // 60 kg a full day
